studyDesigns.name: Study Design
studyDesigns.rationale: Protocol-defined study design for investigating efficacy and safety

population.name: Study Population
population.description: Target population defined by eligibility criteria

objectives.name: Primary Objective
objectives.text: Assess net copper balance with daily repeat-dose ALXN1840 treatment (15 mg and 30 mg) in participants with Wilson disease (WD)

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 1
objectives.text: Assess change in copper balance in response to ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day during ALXN1840 accumulation and at steady state periods versus the pretreatment baseline in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 2
objectives.text: Investigate the effect of ALXN1840 (15 mg/day and 30 mg/day) on the disposition of copper in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 3
objectives.text: Investigate the effect of ALXN1840 on the disposition of molybdenum at steady state at 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 4
objectives.text: Assess steady-state total molybdenum balance as a measure of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 5
objectives.text: Assess accumulation of molybdenum with ALXN1840 treatment at 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 6
objectives.text: Determine the steady-state plasma pharmacokinetic (PK) of total molybdenum and plasma ultrafiltrate (PUF) molybdenum (as surrogate measures of ALXN1840, 15 mg and 30 mg) in participants with WD

objectives.name: Safety Objective
objectives.text: Evaluate the safety and tolerability of repeated-dose administration of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 1
objectives.text: Determine dose response of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day for copper balance in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 2
objectives.text: Determine the effect of treatment duration on copper balance in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 3
objectives.text: Assess the effects of ALXN1840 on ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper LBC profiles in plasma in participants with WD

endpoints.name: Primary Endpoint
endpoints.text: Mean daily copper balance where copper balance is measured by the calculated difference between copper intake (in food and drink) and copper output (in feces and urine) during ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 1
endpoints.text: Change in mean daily copper balance as measured by the calculated difference between copper intake (in food and drink) and copper output (in feces and urine) from pretreatment baseline (Days -4 through -1) and ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 2
endpoints.text: Copper quantified in food, drink, feces, and urine, including plasma total and labile bound copper (LBC) during ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 3
endpoints.text: Molybdenum quantified in food, drink, feces, and urine, plasma total molybdenum at ALXN1840 steady state

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 4
endpoints.text: Mean daily molybdenum balance as demonstrated through measurement of molybdenum intake (in food, drink and ALXN1840), and molybdenum output (feces and urine) representing ALXN1840 steady state

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 5
endpoints.text: Accumulation of molybdenum as determined by molybdenum balance

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 6
endpoints.text: PK parameters for plasma total and PUF-molybdenum

endpoints.name: Safety Endpoint
endpoints.text: Safety parameters: Treatment emergent adverse events (TEAEs)/serious adverse events (SAEs); Clinical laboratory assessments (serum chemistry, hematology, coagulation, and urinalysis); Physical examinations; Heart rate, intervals (PR, QRS, QT and QTc), and clinically significant electrocardiogram (ECG) findings as determined by triplicate 12-lead ECG; Vital sign assessments (blood pressure and heart rate)

endpoints.name: Exploratory Endpoint 1
endpoints.text: Assess dose response of ALXN1840 on copper balance focusing on copper balance

endpoints.name: Exploratory Endpoint 2
endpoints.text: Determine the effect of time following initiation of ALXN1840 treatment on copper balance

endpoints.name: Exploratory Endpoint 3
endpoints.text: Ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper, and LBC: Change in ceruloplasmin at Days 1, 8, 25, 29, 36, and Day 39 compared with predose

notes.text: a. Within 42 days of ALXN1840 administration. Details of procedures that may be performed by sites designated as "screening sites" (only in the US) are detailed in Section 8.
b. Participants will be admitted to the clinical research unit (CRU) at least 10 hours prior to enrollment and initiation of copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet.
c. At the CRU's discretion, participants may remain in the CRU or be readmitted on Day 22 with all procedures starting on Day 23.
d. Unscheduled study visits may occur at any time during the study and may include any study procedure as deemed necessary by the Investigator.
e. Participants are required to return to the CRU Day 54+/-2; participants will be discontinued from ALXN1840 medication by their physician at the latest by the Day 54 follow-up.

f. Discharge from the unit may occur after completion of all procedures on Day 9 and on Day 40 and after the Investigator has reviewed all safety assessment (including safety laboratory tests) and confirmed that the participant is appropriate for discharge.

g. A single outpatient visit or phone call and safety laboratory assessment should occur between Day 14 and Day 18. A phone call may take place on a different day than the blood draw within the Day 14 through Day 18 period.
h. If needed to confirm menopause.
i. Parameters include age and sex. Race and ethnicity will be collected where permitted by local regulations.
j. Wilson disease history will include diagnosis date, method of diagnosis, history of cirrhosis, details of any previous liver biopsies performed, and treatment received.

k. A full physical examination will be performed at Screening, at check-in for the study, and at the End of the study/Early Termination Visit. A physical examination should also be performed on any participants with ongoing adverse events prior to discharge from the unit. Otherwise, a symptom-driven physical examination may be performed at other times, at the Principal Investigator's discretion.
l. Height at screening only.

m. While in the CRU, study intervention will be administered after an overnight fast (ie, at least 10 hours) at the same time every morning; drug is to be administered with 240 mL of water and meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing. As an outpatient, participants are expected to take ALXN1840 at approximately the same time daily (+/-1 hour). Participants should take the medication with a glass of water on an empty stomach; meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing.
n. During the outpatient period, participants will use SMS text messaging to confirm study intervention administration.
o. Blood sampling for PK/PD will occur before ALXN1840 administration and represents a predose trough. See Table 2 for PK/PD sampling on Days 1, 25, 29, and 39.
p. PK/PD collection will include timepoints described in the schedule of PK/PD assessment for Days 1, 25, 29, and 39 (Table 2).

q. Samples for serum chemistry will be obtained following a fast of at least 8 hours at the Screening Visit and at check-in. In case of rechecks, and postdose serum chemistry, participants may not have fasted for 6 or 8 hours before the serum chemistry sample is taken.
r. Laboratory assessment including chemistry, hematology, and coagulation parameters should be performed on Days -8, -1, 8, 23, and 28 only.

s. Menstruation check is for women only; women of childbearing potential should only be enrolled after a negative serum pregnancy test result at Screening. Additional urine pregnancy testing will be standard for the protocol unless serum testing is required by site policies, local regulation, or Institutional Review Boards (IRBs)/Independent Ethics Committees (IECs) (Section 10.2). In addition to pregnancy tests detailed at the visits in the SoA, females of childbearing potential will be required to perform urine pregnancy tests at least every 4 weeks at their home or the study site throughout their time in the study.
t. A single 15 mL serum sample will be retained for evaluation in the event of an unexpected safety finding; retained samples may be destroyed after completion of the clinical report.

u. Vital signs measurements and ECGs should be performed predose, unless otherwise specified. Vitals signs include body temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, and systolic and diastolic blood pressure.

v. Copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet will be initiated after registration/inclusion. Participants will remain on a copper/molybdenum controlled diet throughout both the inpatient Period 1 (Day -8 to Day 9) and inpatient Period 2 (Day 23 to Day 40); during this time participants will be strongly encouraged to complete all meals. While not in the CRU, participants will be encouraged to adhere to their usual copper-controlled diet.
w. For each input/output balance period, 24-hour urine samples are to be collected for measurement of copper and molybdenum.
x. For fecal samples, each individual sample will be independently collected with record of date, time, and weight of the sample.
h. If needed to confirm menopause.
i. Parameters include age and sex. Race and ethnicity will be collected where permitted by local regulations.

4. Participants will have 3 intake and output collection periods including:  Baseline Day -4 through Day -1  Day 1 through Day 8 (I/O for 15 mg)  Day 25 through Day 39 (Days 25 through 28, I/O for 15 mg; Days 29 through 39, I/O for 30 mg)

The protocol specifies screening procedures as a distinct phase occurring only at the start to determine eligibility, with some sites in the US performing only these procedures.
The protocol describes a one-time discontinuation of zinc therapy 21 days prior to study procedures to minimize inhibitory effects on copper absorption.
The study title and rationale indicate a balance study, which typically requires continuous collection of excreta over a multi-day period to assess intake vs. output.
The Schedule of Activities (SoA) and Section 1.3 references indicate procedures that occur across multiple scheduled visits throughout the study duration.

While in the CRU, study intervention will be administered after an overnight fast (ie, at least 10 hours) at the same time every morning; drug is to be administered with 240 mL of water and meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing. Participants should take the medication with a glass of water on an empty stomach; meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing.

footnoteConditions.text: 2. Participants will be admitted to the CRU for Treatment Period 1 on Day -8 and may be discharged on Day 9 or remain in the CRU for their own safety or to maintain the integrity of the conduct of the study. Participants who are discharged will be re-admitted on Day 22 or Day 23 for Treatment Period 2 and will remain in house until Day 40. To ensure flexibility, the Outpatient Period may be extended up to an additional 14 days with Investigator approval. In this situation, participants will be given additional investigational product to support daily dosing throughout the Outpatient Period. In such cases, the actual Outpatient Period duration will be recorded and the participant will continue Inpatient Period 2 at Day 23.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Net Negative Copper Balance

timeWindow.duration: Duration of daily repeat-dose ALXN1840 treatment

endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Net Copper Balance = (Copper Intake) - (Copper Output in Feces + Copper Output in Urine)
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: The primary objective of this study is to demonstrate a net negative copper balance with daily repeat-dose ALXN1840 treatment (15 mg and 30 mg) in participants with WD.

derivedVariables.name: Mean daily copper balance
derivedVariables.derivationRule: (Copper intake in food + Copper intake in drink) - (Copper output in feces + Copper output in urine)

derivedVariables.name: Change in mean daily copper balance
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Post-baseline mean daily copper balance - Pretreatment baseline mean daily copper balance
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Mean daily copper balance calculated from Days -4 through -1
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: Accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

derivedVariables.name: Mean daily molybdenum balance
derivedVariables.derivationRule: (Molybdenum intake in food + drink + ALXN1840) - (Molybdenum output in feces + urine)

derivedVariables.name: NCCcorrected
derivedVariables.derivationRule: NCC corrected for the stable TPC

conditions.name: General
conditions.text: a. Within 42 days of ALXN1840 administration. Details of procedures that may be performed by sites designated as "screening sites" (only in the US) are detailed in Section 8.

conditions.name: Timing Before
conditions.text: b. Participants will be admitted to the clinical research unit (CRU) at least 10 hours prior to enrollment and initiation of copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet.

conditions.name: Timing At
conditions.text: c. At the CRU's discretion, participants may remain in the CRU or be readmitted on Day 22 with all procedures starting on Day 23.

conditions.name: General
conditions.text: d. Unscheduled study visits may occur at any time during the study and may include any study procedure as deemed necessary by the Investigator.

conditions.name: General
conditions.text: e. Participants are required to return to the CRU Day 54+/-2; participants will be discontinued from ALXN1840 medication by their physician at the latest by the Day 54 follow-up.

conditions.name: Timing After
conditions.text: f. Discharge from the unit may occur after completion of all procedures on Day 9 and on Day 40 and after the Investigator has reviewed all safety assessment (including safety laboratory tests) and confirmed that the participant is appropriate for discharge.

conditions.name: General
conditions.text: g. A single outpatient visit or phone call and safety laboratory assessment should occur between Day 14 and Day 18. A phone call may take place on a different day than the blood draw within the Day 14 through Day 18 period.

conditions.name: General
conditions.text: h. If needed to confirm menopause.

conditions.name: General
conditions.text: i. Parameters include age and sex. Race and ethnicity will be collected where permitted by local regulations.

conditions.name: General
conditions.text: j. Wilson disease history will include diagnosis date, method of diagnosis, history of cirrhosis, details of any previous liver biopsies performed, and treatment received.

conditions.name: Timing Before
conditions.text: k. A full physical examination will be performed at Screening, at check-in for the study, and at the End of the study/Early Termination Visit. A physical examination should also be performed on any participants with ongoing adverse events prior to discharge from the unit. Otherwise, a symptom-driven physical examination may be performed at other times, at the Principal Investigator's discretion.

conditions.name: General
conditions.text: l. Height at screening only.

conditions.name: Timing After
conditions.text: m. While in the CRU, study intervention will be administered after an overnight fast (ie, at least 10 hours) at the same time every morning; drug is to be administered with 240 mL of water and meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing. As an outpatient, participants are expected to take ALXN1840 at approximately the same time daily (+/-1 hour). Participants should take the medication with a glass of water on an empty stomach; meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing.

conditions.name: General
conditions.text: n. During the outpatient period, participants will use SMS text messaging to confirm study intervention administration.

conditions.name: Timing Before
conditions.text: o. Blood sampling for PK/PD will occur before ALXN1840 administration and represents a predose trough. See Table 2 for PK/PD sampling on Days 1, 25, 29, and 39.

conditions.name: General
conditions.text: p. PK/PD collection will include timepoints described in the schedule of PK/PD assessment for Days 1, 25, 29, and 39 (Table 2).

conditions.name: Timing Before
conditions.text: q. Samples for serum chemistry will be obtained following a fast of at least 8 hours at the Screening Visit and at check-in. In case of rechecks, and postdose serum chemistry, participants may not have fasted for 6 or 8 hours before the serum chemistry sample is taken.

conditions.name: General
conditions.text: r. Laboratory assessment including chemistry, hematology, and coagulation parameters should be performed on Days -8, -1, 8, 23, and 28 only.

conditions.name: Timing After
conditions.text: s. Menstruation check is for women only; women of childbearing potential should only be enrolled after a negative serum pregnancy test result at Screening. Additional urine pregnancy testing will be standard for the protocol unless serum testing is required by site policies, local regulation, or Institutional Review Boards (IRBs)/Independent Ethics Committees (IECs) (Section 10.2). In addition to pregnancy tests detailed at the visits in the SoA, females of childbearing potential will be required to perform urine pregnancy tests at least every 4 weeks at their home or the study site throughout their time in the study.

conditions.name: Timing After
conditions.text: t. A single 15 mL serum sample will be retained for evaluation in the event of an unexpected safety finding; retained samples may be destroyed after completion of the clinical report.

conditions.name: General
conditions.text: u. Vital signs measurements and ECGs should be performed predose, unless otherwise specified. Vitals signs include body temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, and systolic and diastolic blood pressure.

conditions.name: Timing After
conditions.text: v. Copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet will be initiated after registration/inclusion. Participants will remain on a copper/molybdenum controlled diet throughout both the inpatient Period 1 (Day -8 to Day 9) and inpatient Period 2 (Day 23 to Day 40); during this time participants will be strongly encouraged to complete all meals. While not in the CRU, participants will be encouraged to adhere to their usual copper-controlled diet.

conditions.name: General
conditions.text: w. For each input/output balance period, 24-hour urine samples are to be collected for measurement of copper and molybdenum.

conditions.name: General
conditions.text: x. For fecal samples, each individual sample will be independently collected with record of date, time, and weight of the sample.

conditions.name: Frequency Continuous
conditions.text: 1. Participants eligible for the study will be enrolled on Day -7 and initiated on a copper- and molybdenum- controlled diet, which will be continued during Treatment Period 1 and Treatment Period 2 when in the CRU, through Day 39.

conditions.name: Timing At
conditions.text: 2. Participants will be admitted to the CRU for Treatment Period 1 on Day -8 and may be discharged on Day 9 or remain in the CRU for their own safety or to maintain the integrity of the conduct of the study. Participants who are discharged will be re-admitted on Day 22 or Day 23 for Treatment Period 2 and will remain in house until Day 40. To ensure flexibility, the Outpatient Period may be extended up to an additional 14 days with Investigator approval. In this situation, participants will be given additional investigational product to support daily dosing throughout the Outpatient Period. In such cases, the actual Outpatient Period duration will be recorded and the participant will continue Inpatient Period 2 at Day 23.

conditions.name: Timing At
conditions.text: 3. Participants will be administered ALXN1840 at a dose of 15 mg/day on Day 1 through Day 28 and then increase to 30 mg/day on Day 29 through Day 39. During the Outpatient Period, participants will use SMS text messaging to confirm study intervention administration.

conditions.name: General
conditions.text: 4. Participants will have 3 intake and output collection periods including:  Baseline Day -4 through Day -1  Day 1 through Day 8 (I/O for 15 mg)  Day 25 through Day 39 (Days 25 through 28, I/O for 15 mg; Days 29 through 39, I/O for 30 mg)

conditions.name: General
conditions.text: 5. During these periods all intake (including food and drink) and output (including urine and feces) will be collected and assessed for copper and molybdenum.

conditions.name: General
conditions.text: 6. Blood sampling for PK/PD will be as follows:  PK/PD collection (24-hour): Days 1, 25, 29, and 39  Predose PK/PD sampling days: Days 4 - 7, Days 26 - 28, Days 30 - 38  End of Study Visit Day 54 +/- 2 days Abbreviations: AP = accumulation period; CRU = clinical research unit; EOS = End of Study; I/O = input/output; PD = pharmacodynamic; PK = pharmacokinetic; SS = steady state.

administrations.name: ALXN1840 Administration
administrations.description: Administration of Study Interventionm ALXN1840 15 mg/day           ALXN1840 30 mg/day      Study intervention compliance Xn  PK/PD Analyseso

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Age requirement
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants aged 18 at the time of signing the ICF.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Diagnosis of WD
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Diagnosis of WD by Leipzig Criteria  4 documented by testing as outlined in the 2012 European Association for the Study of Liver WD Clinical Practice Guidelines (Ferenci, 2003; EASL, 2012) or by historical test results for WD including some or all of the following: Presence of Kayser Fleischer rings, Neurological symptoms, Serum ceruloplasmin below reference range, Coombs-negative hemolytic anemia, Elevated liver or urinary copper, Presence of mutations in the ATP7B gene, or Other, as considered appropriate, may be used instead to confirm the diagnosis of WD.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Benefit from decoppering therapy
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants who in the opinion of the referring Investigator may benefit from decoppering therapy.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Compliance with procedures
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants must be able to comply with all study-related procedures.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Reside in CRU
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants must be able to reside in the CRU for intensive metabolic monitoring of copper and molybdenum.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Discontinue chelator therapy
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants willing to discontinue chelator therapy for approximately 4 days prior to initiation of ALXN1840 to allow a baseline assessment of copper balance.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Venous access
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants with adequate venous access to allow collection of required blood samples.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Swallow intact tablets
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants must be able to swallow intact ALXN1840 tablets.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Avoid mineral use
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants willing to avoid use of minerals containing copper, zinc, or molybdenum throughout the study duration.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Dietary adherence
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants willing to adhere to copper/molybdenum-controlled diet during inpatient periods and willing to comply with a low copper dietary requirement during the Outpatient Period.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Contraceptive use
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Contraceptive use by men or women should be consistent with local regulations regarding the methods of contraception for those participating in clinical studies. (Including specific requirements for male and female participants as detailed in protocol section 5.1.11).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Informed Consent
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants capable of giving signed informed consent, which includes compliance with the requirements and restrictions listed in the ICF and in this protocol.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Decompensated cirrhosis
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Decompensated cirrhosis or model for end-stage liver disease (MELD) score > 13.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Modified Nazer score
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Modified Nazer score > 7 (Dhawan, 2005).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Gastrointestinal bleed
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Clinically significant gastrointestinal bleed within past 3 months.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: ALT elevation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) > 2  upper limit of normal (ULN).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Neurological disease
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Marked neurological disease requiring assistance with self-care or activities of daily life.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Hemoglobin level
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Hemoglobin less than lower limit of the reference range for age and sex.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Active infection
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Active infection with hepatitis B virus (positive hepatitis B surface antigen) or C virus (participants with positive hepatitis C antibody result would require confirmation of active disease with a positive hepatitis C polymerase chain reaction test), or seropositivity for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Other medical disorders
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History or presence of/significant history of or current cardiovascular, respiratory, hepatic, renal, gastrointestinal, endocrinological, hematological, or neurological disorders, or psychiatric disorder that in the opinion of the Investigator may constitute a risk when taking the study intervention; or may interfere with the interpretation of data.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Previous ALXN1840 treatment
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Previous treatment with ALXN1840 or other form of tetrathiomolybdate within 1 year prior to dosing.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Previous zinc treatment
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Previous treatment with zinc within 21 days prior to Day 1.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Experimental therapy
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: The use of an experimental or unapproved/unlicensed therapy at the same time or within 90 days or 5 half-lives, whichever is longer, prior to the Screening Visit.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Renal failure
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants in renal failure, defined as in end-stage renal disease on dialysis (chronic kidney disease [CKD] stage 5) or creatinine clearance < 30 mL/min (Levey, 2006).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Pregnancy or breastfeeding
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Pregnant (or females who are planning to become pregnant) or breastfeeding females (women of childbearing potential must have a negative serum pregnancy test result at screening).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Known sensitivity
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Known sensitivity to ALXN1840, ALXN1840 excipients (anhydrous dicalcium phosphate, anhydrous sodium carbonate), or any of the ingredients contained in ALXN1840 or related compounds.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Non-compliance
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: In the opinion of the Investigator, the participant and/or their legal guardian is likely to be non-compliant or uncooperative during the study.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Substance abuse
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of illicit drug abuse, history of significant alcohol abuse within 1 year prior to the Screening Visit, or clinical evidence of substance and/or alcohol abuse within the 2 years before screening. Alcohol abuse is defined as regular weekly intake of more than 14 units (for both males and females).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Positive drug screen
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Positive urine drug toxicology screen at Screening or on Day -8 (cannabinoids will not be tested).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Alcohol consumption
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Alcohol consumption within 48 hours prior to study intervention administration or positive alcohol breath test at screening or on Day -8.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Meal completion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants unwilling to consistently complete every meal and tolerate a controlled, limited menu for the duration of the study.

studyInterventions.name: ALXN1840
studyInterventions.description: Novel copper binding agent (bis-choline tetrathiomolybdate) for the treatment of Wilson disease.

studyInterventions.name: Copper-chelating therapies
studyInterventions.description: Penicillamine or trientine; must be discontinued starting on Day -4.

studyInterventions.name: Zinc therapy
studyInterventions.description: Must be discontinued at least 21 days prior to Day 1.

studyInterventions.name: Paracetamol/acetaminophen
studyInterventions.description: Permitted up to a maximum of 1000 mg per day with Investigator approval.

studyInterventions.name: Ibuprofen
studyInterventions.description: Permitted with caution; dose must not exceed 1200 mg in any 24-hour period.

studyInterventions.name: St Johns wort
studyInterventions.description: Prohibited; must be discontinued 2 weeks before first study intervention.

amendments.name: Amendment 1
amendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to update procedures outlined in the Schedule of Activities, remove contradictory text on the reporting of serious adverse events, and add details of an interim analysis.

amendments.name: Amendment 2
amendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to revise the exclusion criterion for a urine drug screen. Changes implemented via Administrative Letter 1 and Administrative Letter 2, as well as COVID vaccination guidance, have also been incorporated.

amendments.name: Amendment 3
amendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to update the washout period for zinc.

amendments.name: Amendment 3.1 (US)
amendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to clarify study procedures occurring across different sites in the US, so as to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US, and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study.

conditions.name: Safety Review Committee Approval

conditions.text: SRC will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant before titration to 30 mg/day.

conditions.name: Liver Injury Criteria
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 x ULN accompanied by ALT > 3 x ULN

conditions.name: Renal Failure Exclusion
conditions.text: Creatinine clearance < 30 mL/min or CKD stage 5

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration
transitionRules.text: Increase to 30 mg on Day 29 unless safety concerns exist.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Neutrophils
transitionRules.text: If Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline, reduce dose to previous level or 15 mg QOD.

transitionRules.name: Temporary Interruption for Liver Injury
transitionRules.text: Temporary interruption of dosing if Bilirubin > 2x ULN and ALT > 3x ULN.

commentAnnotations.text: Procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) detailed in Section 8
The physiologic turnover of human gastrointestinal epithelial cells is 3 - 5 days (Darwich, 2014)
Acetaminophen should be limited to 1000 mg/day.

Total molybdenum and PUF-molybdenum concentration-time profiles on Day 28 after the last 15 mg ALXN1840 dose will be extrapolated to Day 29 and subtracted from the observed Day 29 concentration-time profiles.

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Substantial amendment to clarify US screening site procedures and facilitate recruitment.

studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Added footnote regarding procedures specific to US screening sites.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 4.2 Scientific Rationale for Study Design
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Updated the duration of zinc inhibitory effects on intestinal copper absorption.
Introduced US-specific provision allowing sites to perform only screening procedures without subsequent study procedures.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: To facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US and lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising study quality.
To align the number of days for zinc discontinuation effects with mentions elsewhere in the protocol.

studyChanges.afterText: Procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) detailed in Section 8
studyChanges.summary: Added footnote to SoA Table 1 regarding US screening sites.

studyChanges.beforeText: minimal 30 days after discontinuation of zinc
studyChanges.afterText: minimal 21 days after discontinuation of zinc
studyChanges.summary: Reduced the expected duration of zinc's inhibitory effect from 30 to 21 days.

studyChanges.afterText: Addition of text applicable only to the US that details the possibility for sites in the US to only perform screening procedures and not any of the remaining study procedures.
studyChanges.summary: Added provision for US-based screening-only sites.
